definition: to separate and live apart/division of a large family into smaller groups
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: The household division is an important thing in rural family.
sentences.chinese: 分家析产是农户家庭生活中的重要事件。

sentences.english: But here is where Turtles separated.
The household division is one of the custom that our civil source flows to grow far.
sentences.chinese: 分家析产是我国民间源远流长的习俗之一。

sentences.english: By researching the land-inheriting cases, the paper shows the others ways of land-inheriting outside the separation.
sentences.chinese: 并通过土地继承纠纷案件探讨了分家以外的继承方式。

sentences.english: Implementing the river and lake after breaking up the family, a township that establishes newly.
sentences.chinese: 实施河湖分家后，新成立的一个乡。

sentences.english: Macao casino tycoon says he was given raw deal.
sentences.chinese: 澳门赌场何鸿燊称被家人“劫持”分家。

sentences.english: Obert: As to marketing, I think it would be best to divvy up the pot.
sentences.chinese: 关于行销，我认为最好的方式是分家。

sentences.english: The new stirps are the newsubject of rights.
sentences.chinese: 分家的结果就是新家系的诞生。

definition: to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
to live independently/to live on one's own
to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
princely
to live apart from parents (of married couple)/to achieve independence
second-eldest child in a family/(euphemism) penis
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
to remarry (of a woman)
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
family property
second branch of an extended family/concubine
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
the whole family
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
family/clan
